Description of the session: The welfare state arrived in Sámi Home Area, in the Nordic countries, relatively late and at a rapid pace. Introduction of the welfare services together with the ongoing modernization processes challenged the traditional Sámi institutions, lifestyles and cultural conducts. The initial starting point of the welfare state ideology was based on production of equal services to everyone regardless of one’s background. The aim of equality functions well for the majority, when the needs and background are similar, but may result in inequalities for the minority with different needs. The complex matters and relationships involved to the question have until so far not been widely investigated. The presentations introduce reflexive Sámi angles of the topical problems related to this phenomenon both from the perspective of public health service production, health promotion and health outcome focusing especially on the cultural perspective.
